content:
TITLE: Creating a Basic Bitcoin Wallet and Generating an Address in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a wallet and generate a new Bitcoin address using the BitcoinLib wallet module. This creates a hierarchical deterministic wallet and returns a new key with its corresponding address.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet
>>> w = Wallet.create('Wallet1')
>>> key1 = w.get_key()
>>> key1.address
'1Fo7STj6LdRhUuD1AiEsHpH65pXzraGJ9j'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Bitcoin from a Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to send bitcoins to a specific address. The wallet automatically selects appropriate UTXOs, calculates fees, and creates a valid transaction which is returned as an object with the transaction ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> t = w.send_to('1PWXhWvUH3bcDWn6Fdq3xhMRPfxRXTjAi1', '0.001 BTC')
'b7feea5e7c79d4f6f343b5ca28fa2a1fcacfe9a2b7f44f3d2fd8d6c2d82c4078'
>>> t.info()  # Shows transaction information and send results
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Bitcoin Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new Bitcoin wallet which can manage keys, track UTXOs, and create transactions. This is the high-level interface that combines the functionality of many BitcoinLib components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet
w = Wallet.create('jupyter-test-wallet')
w.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Bitcoin from a Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Creates and broadcasts a transaction to send Bitcoin from a wallet to a specified address. This demonstrates the full transaction creation, signing, and broadcasting process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.wallets import wallet_create_or_open

w = wallet_create_or_open('bitcoinlib-testnet1', network='testnet', witness_type='segwit')
t = w.send_to('tb1qprqnf4dqwuphxs9xqpzkjdgled6eeptn389nec', 4000, fee=1000)
t.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Bitcoin Wallet
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a new Bitcoin wallet using the Command Line Wallet script. It generates a new wallet with a specified name and displays the wallet information, including the passphrase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.command-line-wallet.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ clw new -w mywallet
CREATE wallet 'newwallet' (bitcoin network)
Passphrase: sibling undo gift cat garage survey taxi index admit odor surface waste
Please write it down on paper and backup. With this key you can restore your wallet and all keys

Type 'yes' if you understood and wrote down your key: yes
Wallet info for newwallet
=== WALLET ===
 ID                             21
 Name                           newwallet
 Owner
 Scheme                         bip32
 Multisig                       False
 Witness type                   segwit
 Main network                   bitcoin
 Latest update                  None

= Wallet Master Key =
 ID                             177
 Private                        True
 Depth                          0

- NETWORK: bitcoin -
- - Keys
  182 m/84'/0'/0'/0/0              bc1qza24j7snqlmx7603z8qplm4rzfkr0p0mneraqv    address index 0                        0.00000000 ₿

- - Transactions Account 0 (0)

= Balance Totals (includes unconfirmed) =
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Multi-Currency Wallet from Mnemonic Passphrase
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a hierarchical deterministic wallet with multiple accounts and different cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin and Litecoin) from a single mnemonic passphrase, enabling full wallet recovery from one seed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet, wallet_delete
from bitcoinlib.mnemonic import Mnemonic

passphrase = Mnemonic().generate()
print(passphrase)
w = Wallet.create("Wallet2", keys=passphrase, network='bitcoin')
account_btc2 = w.new_account('Account BTC 2')
account_ltc1 = w.new_account('Account LTC', network='litecoin')
w.get_key()
w.get_key(account_btc2.account_id)
w.get_key(account_ltc1.account_id)
w.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Bitcoin Transaction
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to send Bitcoin to an address using the wallet's send_to method and display transaction information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> t = w.send_to('bc1qemtr8ywkzg483g8m34ukz2l4pl3730776vzq54', '0.001 BTC', offline=False)
'b7feea5e7c79d4f6f343b5ca28fa2a1fcacfe9a2b7f44f3d2fd8d6c2d82c4078'
>>> t.info  # Shows transaction information and send results
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a 2-of-2 Multi-Signature Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a multi-signature wallet requiring 2 signatures to authorize transactions. This example creates two cosigner wallets with the necessary private and public keys for secure multi-party transactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet
from bitcoinlib.keys import HDKey

NETWORK = 'testnet'
k1 = HDKey('tprv8ZgxMBicQKsPd1Q44tfDiZC98iYouKRC2CzjT3HGt1yYw2zuX2awTotzGAZQEAU9bi2M5MCj8iedP9MREPjUgpDEBwBgGi2C8eK5zNYeiX8', network=NETWORK)
k2 = HDKey('tprv8ZgxMBicQKsPeUbMS6kswJc11zgVEXUnUZuGo3bF6bBrAg1ieFfUdPc9UHqbD5HcXizThrcKike1c4z6xHrz6MWGwy8L6YKVbgJMeQHdWDp', network=NETWORK)
w1 = Wallet.create('multisig_2of2_cosigner1', sigs_required=2,
                     keys=[k1, k2.public_master(multisig=True)], network=NETWORK)
w2 = Wallet.create('multisig_2of2_cosigner2',  sigs_required=2,
                     keys=[k1.public_master(multisig=True), k2], network=NETWORK)
print("Deposit testnet bitcoin to this address to create transaction: ", w1.get_key().address)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Simple Bitcoin Transaction
DESCRIPTION: Creates a basic transaction with one input and one output, sending funds to a newly generated address. Demonstrates the core structure of a Bitcoin transaction.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.transactions import Transaction
from bitcoinlib.keys import HDKey

t = Transaction()
prev_hash = '9c81f44c29ff0226f835cd0a8a2f2a7eca6db52a711f8211b566fd15d3e0e8d4'
t.add_input(prev_hash, output_n=0)
k = HDKey()
t.add_output(100000, k.address())
t.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Completing and Broadcasting a Multi-Signature Transaction
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import a partially signed transaction into the second cosigner wallet, apply the second signature, and broadcast the completed transaction to the network.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
w2.get_key()
t2 = w2.transaction_import(t)
t2.sign()
t2.send()
t2.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Multi-signature Bitcoin Wallet
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the process of creating a 2-of-2 multi-signature wallet using the Command Line Wallet. It shows how to generate private keys, create the wallet, and view wallet information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.command-line-wallet.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ clw -g -n bitcoinlib_test -y
Command Line Wallet - BitcoinLib 0.6.14

Passphrase: marine kiwi great try know scan rigid indicate place gossip fault liquid
Please write down on paper and backup. With this key you can restore your wallet and all keys

Type 'yes' if you understood and wrote down your key: yes
Private Master key, to create multisig wallet on this machine:
BC19UtECk2r9PVQYhY4yboRf92XKEnKZf9hQEd1qBqCgQ98HkBeysLPqYewcWDUuaBRSSVXCShDfmhpbtgZ33sWeGPqfwoLwamzPEcnfwLoeqfQM
Public Master key, to share with other cosigner multisig wallets:
BC18rEEZrakM87qWbSSUv19vnRkEFL7ZtNtGx3exB886VbeFZp6aq9JLZucYAj1EtsHKUB2mkjvafCCGaeYeUVtdFcz5xTxTTgEPCE8fDC8LcahM
Network: bitcoinlib_test

$ clw -g -n bitcoinlib_test -y
Command Line Wallet - BitcoinLib 0.6.14

Passphrase: trumpet utility cotton couch hard shadow ivory alpha glance pear snow emerge
Please write down on paper and backup. With this key you can restore your wallet and all keys

BC19UtECk2r9PVQYhaAa8kEgBMPWHC4fJVJD48zBMMb9gSpY9LQVvQ1HhzB3Xmkm2BpiH5SyWoboiewpbeexPLsw8QBfAqMbDfet6kLhedtfQF8r

BC18rEEvE8begagfJs7kdxx1yW9tFsz7879c9vQQ2mnGbF6WSeKuBEGtmxJYLEy8rpVV9wXffbBtnL1LPKZqujPtEKzHqQeERiRybKB3DRBBoSFH
Network: bitcoinlib_test

$ clw new -w multisig-2-2 -n bitcoinlib_test -m 2 2 BC19UtECk2r9PVQYhY4yboRf92XKEnKZf9hQEd1qBqCgQ98HkBeysLPqYewcWDUuaBRSSVXCShDfmhpbtgZ33sWeGPqfwoLwamzPEcnfwLoeqfQM BC18rEEvE8begagfJs7kdxx1yW9tFsz7879c9vQQ2mnGbF6WSeKuBEGtmxJYLEy8rpVV9wXffbBtnL1LPKZqujPtEKzHqQeERiRybKB3DRBBoSFH

    0 183 BC18rEEvE8begagfJs7kdxx1yW9tFsz7879c9vQQ2mnGbF6WSeKuBEGtmxJYLEy8rpVV9wXffbBtnL1LPKZqujPtEKzHqQeERiRybKB3DRBBoSFH bip32  cosigner
    1 186 BC18rEEZrakM87qWbSSUv19vnRkEFL7ZtNtGx3exB886VbeFZp6aq9JLZucYAj1EtsHKUB2mkjvafCCGaeYeUVtdFcz5xTxTTgEPCE8fDC8LcahM bip32  main     *
For main keys a private master key is available in this wallet to sign transactions. * cosigner key for this wallet

- NETWORK: bitcoinlib_test -
- - Keys

- - Transactions Account 0 (0)

= Balance Totals (includes unconfirmed) =
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning for Transactions and Displaying Wallet Information
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the scan method to update a wallet with new transactions and unspent outputs (UTXOs), then display wallet information including keys, transactions and balances.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> w.scan()
>>> w.info()  # Shows wallet information, keys, transactions and UTXO's
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Testnet Segwit Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Bitcoin testnet wallet with segwit address support and generates a new receiving address. This demonstrates creating specialized wallets for testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.wallets import wallet_create_or_open

w = wallet_create_or_open('bitcoinlib-testnet1', network='testnet', witness_type='segwit')
wk = w.new_key()
print("Deposit to address %s to get started" % wk.address)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Native Segregated Witness (P2WPKH) Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a native SegWit wallet with bech32 addresses (bc1 prefix). This wallet type provides lower transaction fees and improved scalability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet
>>> w = Wallet.create('segwit_p2wpkh', witness_type='segwit')
>>> w.get_key().address
bc1q84y2quplejutvu0h4gw9hy59fppu3thg0u2xz3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Transaction with BitcoinLib Command Line Wallet
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a transaction of 0.1 TST from a multisignature wallet, displaying the transaction details including inputs, outputs, fees, and status. The transaction requires another signature before it can be verified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.command-line-wallet.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ clw -w ms22 -s blt1qxu6z7evkrmz5s7sk63dr0u3h9xsf2j2vys88reg75cjvjuz4vf2srkxp7p 0.1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Bitcoin Wallet and Generating Address
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to create a new Bitcoin wallet and generate a receiving address using BitcoinLib's Wallet class.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet
>>> w = Wallet.create('Wallet1')
>>> w.get_key().address
'bc1qk25wwkvz3am9smmm3372xct5s7cwf0hmnq8szj'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Transaction in a Multi-Signature Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a transaction in the first cosigner wallet of a multi-signature setup. This initiates the transaction that will require signatures from all required parties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
w1.utxos_update()
t = w1.sweep('mwCwTceJvYV27KXBc3NJZys6CjsgsoeHmf', min_confirms=0)
t.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scanning Wallet for Transactions
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to scan a wallet for new transactions and display wallet information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> w.scan()
>>> w.info()  # Shows wallet information, keys, transactions and UTXO's
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Funds and Creating a Transaction
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to send funds using the Command Line Wallet. It shows the usage of the -t option to specify the recipient address and amount, and mentions additional options for setting fees and pushing transactions to the network.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.command-line-wallet.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ clw -w mywallet -d dbtest -t bc1qza24j7snqlmx7603z8qplm4rzfkr0p0mneraqv 10000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating a Wallet's UTXOs
DESCRIPTION: Updates a wallet by checking for new unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) from blockchain service providers. This keeps the wallet's balance and available funds current.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.wallets import wallet_create_or_open

w = wallet_create_or_open('bitcoinlib-testnet1', network='testnet', witness_type='segwit')
n_utxos = w.utxos_update()
if n_utxos:
    print("Found new unspent outputs (UTXO's), we are ready to create a transaction")
w.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating an Encrypted Wallet Database in Bitcoinlib using SQLCipher
DESCRIPTION: Python code to create and open an encrypted wallet database in Bitcoinlib using SQLCipher. It demonstrates how to provide a password and database URI when initializing a wallet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.sqlcipher.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
password = 'secret'
db_uri = '/home/user/.bitcoinlib/database/bcl_encrypted.db'
wlt = wallet_create_or_open('bcltestwlt4', network='bitcoinlib_test', db_uri=db_uri, db_password=password)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a P2SH-Nested Segregated Witness Wallet
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates creating a P2SH-nested SegWit wallet that has traditional Bitcoin addresses starting with '3' but still provides SegWit benefits. This type offers better compatibility with older wallets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from bitcoinlib.wallets import Wallet
>>> w = Wallet.create('segwit_p2sh_p2wpkh', witness_type='p2sh-segwit')
>>> w.get_key().address
36ESSWgR4WxXJSc4ysDSJvecyY6FJkhUbp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing a Private Key Using WIF Format
DESCRIPTION: Imports an existing private key using its Wallet Import Format (WIF) and displays the corresponding Bitcoin address. This shows how to work with existing keys in BitcoinLib.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.keys import Key
wif = 'KyAoQkmmoAgdC8YXamgpqFb2R8j6g5jiBnGdJo62aDJCxstboTqS'
k = Key(wif)
print(k.address())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating and Using a Mnemonic Phrase for Keys
DESCRIPTION: Creates a BIP39 mnemonic phrase and demonstrates how to derive an HD key from it. Mnemonic phrases provide a human-readable way to backup and recover private keys.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.mnemonic import Mnemonic
from bitcoinlib.keys import HDKey

phrase = Mnemonic().generate()
print(phrase)
k = HDKey.from_passphrase(phrase)
print(k.private_hex)

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating a Receive Address for a Bitcoin Wallet
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to generate and display an unused receive address for a specific wallet. It uses the -r or --receive option to show the address, and mentions the option to display QR codes if the pyqrcode module is installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.command-line-wallet.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ clw -w mywallet -r
Command Line Wallet for BitcoinLib

Receive address is bc1qza24j7snqlmx7603z8qplm4rzfkr0p0mneraqv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating HD Key Paths for Wallets
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates two methods for creating and sharing public master keys, which is useful for creating watch-only wallets or sharing public keys without revealing private keys.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.keys import HDKey

prv_masterkey = HDKey()
pub_masterkey = prv_masterkey.public_master()
print("Public masterkey to exchange (method 1): %s" % pub_masterkey.wif())
pub_masterkey = prv_masterkey.subkey_for_path("m/44'/0'/0'")
print("Public masterkey to exchange (method 2): %s" % pub_masterkey.wif())

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Hierarchical Deterministic Key (HDKey)
DESCRIPTION: Creates a segwit-compatible HD key and displays its information. HDKeys extend the Key class by adding chain code and hierarchical structure capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.keys import HDKey
k = HDKey(witness_type='segwit')
k.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Examining a Key in BitcoinLib
DESCRIPTION: Creates a random Bitcoin key using the Key class and displays its information including private key, public key, address and WIF. This demonstrates the basic functionality of the Key class.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.keys import Key
k = Key()
k.info()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Managing a Multi-signature Bitcoin Wallet
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to manage a multi-signature wallet, including generating a receive address, updating unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs), and viewing wallet information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.command-line-wallet.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ clw -w ms22 -r

    1 186 BC18rEEZrakM87qWbSSUv19vnRkEFL7ZtNtGx3exB886VbeFZp6aq9JLZucYAj1EtsHKUB2mkjvafCCGaeYeUVtdFcz5xTxTTgEPCE8fDC8LcahM bip32  main     *

- - Transactions Account 0 (2)

5d0f176259ab4bc596363aa3653c44858ebeb2fd8361311966776192968e545d blt1qxu6z7evkrmz5s7sk63dr0u3h9xsf2j2vys88reg75cjvjuz4vf2srkxp7p       10          1.00000000 T U

= Balance Totals (includes unconfirmed) =
bitcoinlib_test      (Account 0)                  2.00000000 T
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Encrypting and Decrypting a Bitcoin Key
DESCRIPTION: Creates a key, encrypts it with a password, and then demonstrates how to import the encrypted key. This shows BitcoinLib's key security features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.keys import Key
k = Key()
print(k.private_hex)
encrypted_wif = k.encrypt('secret')
print(encrypted_wif)

k_import = Key(encrypted_wif, password='secret')
print(k_import.private_hex)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Child Keys from an HD Master Key
DESCRIPTION: Imports an HD key from an extended WIF and demonstrates creating private and public child keys, showing the hierarchical key derivation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/bitcoinlib-10-minutes.ipynb#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.keys import HDKey

extended_wif = 'zprvAWgYBBk7JR8Gk4CexKBHgzfYiYXgV71Ybi2tJFU2yDn8RgiqsviqT4eYPE9LofWMdrSkYmWciMtiD7jqA5dccDLnJj' \
               'DSMghhGRv41vHo9yx'
k = HDKey(extended_wif)
ck = k.child_private(10)
print("ck.private_hex: %s" % ck.private_hex)
print("ck.depth: %s" % ck.depth)
ck_pub = ck.child_public(0)
print("ck_pub.private_hex: %s" % ck_pub.private_hex)
print("ck_pub.public_hex: %s" % ck_pub.public_hex)
print("ck_pub.depth: %s" % ck_pub.depth)
```

TITLE: Implementing BitGo Service Class
DESCRIPTION: Python class implementation for the BitGo service provider, extending BaseClient with methods for API interaction and fee estimation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.add-provider.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bitcoinlib.services.baseclient import BaseClient

PROVIDERNAME = 'bitgo'


class BitGoClient(BaseClient):

    def __init__(self, network, base_url, denominator, api_key=''):
        super(self.__class__, self).\
            __init__(network, PROVIDERNAME, base_url, denominator, api_key)

    def compose_request(self, category, data, cmd='', variables=None, method='get'):
        if data:
            data = '/' + data
        url_path = category + data
        if cmd:
            url_path += '/' + cmd
        return self.request(url_path, variables, method=method)

    def estimatefee(self, blocks):
        res = self.compose_request('tx', 'fee', variables={'numBlocks': blocks})
        return res['feePerKb']
```

DESCRIPTION: Command to remove the installation log file, which triggers regeneration of config files after an update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.install.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: none
CODE:
```
$ rm .bitcoinlib/install.log
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing BitcoinLib Dependencies on Ubuntu
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install required system packages for BitcoinLib on Ubuntu-based Linux systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ sudo apt install build-essential python3-dev libgmp3-dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up a Virtual Environment for BitcoinLib
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create and activate a virtual environment for BitcoinLib installation, which helps isolate dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.install.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ virtualenv -p ~/.virtualenvs/bitcoinlib
$ source ~/.virtualenvs/bitcoinlib/bin/activate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading BitcoinLib with pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to upgrade an existing BitcoinLib installation to the latest version using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.install.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: none
CODE:
```
$ pip install bitcoinlib --upgrade
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Service to Library Init
DESCRIPTION: Python import statement to include the new BitGo service in the library's initialization file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.add-provider.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import bitcoinlib.services.bitgo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Python Package Dependencies for Bitcoinlib
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the minimum required versions of Python packages needed by the Bitcoinlib project. Includes HTTP requests library, database ORM, cryptographic functions, documentation tools, and mathematical computation packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
requests>=2.25.0
SQLAlchemy>=2.0.20
fastecdsa>=2.3.0
sphinx>=7.2.0
sphinx_rtd_theme>=2.0.0
numpy>=1.22.0
pycryptodome>=3.19.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Bcoin Node using Docker
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull a pre-configured Docker image for Bcoin that has optimal settings for use with Bitcoinlib.
SOURCE: https://github.com/1200wd/bitcoinlib/blob/master/docs/_static/manuals.setup-bcoin.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker pull blocksmurfer/bcoin
```
